alert.note: Alert for Colquitt; Dougherty; Lee; Turner; Worth (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 30 at 7:27PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Dougherty, west central Turner, Lee, northwestern Colquitt and Worth Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 726 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Leesburg to Doerun. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sylvester, Leesburg, Albany, Poulan, Doerun, Marine Corps Logistics Base, Turner City, Sumner, Warwick, Bridgeboro, Minton, Chokee, Stocks, Sylvester Airport, Anderson City, Tempy, Parkerville, Red Rock, Acree and Pritchetts. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
